intro: Hieracium percnopum, commonly known as the yellow hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, thriving in temperate climates. Its leaves are hairy and alternate, while its yellow flowers bloom in clusters, attracting various pollinators. Hieracium percnopum is often considered a weed in agricultural settings due to its rapid growth and ability to spread easily.
